thread.title: Sutton United’s Craig Eastmond could miss FA Cup clash with Arsenal due to weather
thread.title_full: Sutton United’s Craig Eastmond could miss FA Cup clash with Arsenal due to weather

author: leeastley
title: Sutton United’s Craig Eastmond could miss FA Cup clash with Arsenal due to weather

locations.name: gander green lane empics sport eastmond

organizations.name: leeds where eagles share sutton united

text:
Craig Eastmond could be banned for Sutton’s clash with Arsenal due to weather Fans reaction to Sutton United getting Arsenal in the FA Cup fifth round 
However, the 26-year-old, who played in the Champions League for Arsene Wenger's side in 2010 against Shakhtar Donetsk, was sent off in United's FA Trophy match against Boreham Wood last Saturday. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The midfielder now has an anxious wait while he serves a three-match ban to see if the replay against Boreham Wood and their league fixtures against Solihull and Guiseley go ahead, with cold weather expected to hit over the next few days. 
He said: "I'm on tenterhooks. It's an unbelievable situation. Obviously I desperately want to play against Arsenal, my old club - but now I just have to wait and hope. 
"Yes, it was a bad tackle, but I never meant to hurt the guy. I thought I got the ball first - that was what I was trying to do. Reuters Eastmond was sent off in United's FA Trophy match against Boreham Wood related stories LIFE'S A PITCH Arsenal get just 750 tickets for FA Cup tie at Sutton United – their lowest allocation ever for an away match Man UTD leed the way Red Devils dominate FA Cup TV with 5.3million viewers . . just 500,000 watch Sutton beat Leeds WHERE EAGLES SHARE Sutton United to decide not to move massive FA Cup tie against Arsenal to Crystal Palace's Selhurst Park Dreaming deacon Sutton striker Roarie Deacon hails magic of the FA Cup as fans celebrate drawing Arsenal... while fellow minnows Lincoln get Burnley CUP FOR IT FA Cup fifth round draw - As it happened: Sutton United bag tie of the round as Arsenal travel to Gander Green Lane EMPICS Sport Eastmond played in the Champions League for Arsene Wenger's side in 2010 
"There was no intent to hurt. Obviously I'm a bit nervous right now. 
"I am keeping a real close eye on the weather forecasts - the worry is that it say it is going to get colder! 
"We have three games, Boreham Wood tonight, Solihull away on Saturday and Guiseley away on Tuesday. 
"I am keeping an eye on all their websites as well to check on their pitches!" Sutton United 1-0 Leeds : Collins’ penalty causes FA Cup shock
